website_summaries.verdict: A great option for call centers and those who spend much of their workday on the phone.
pros: Suitable for use in an office
Comfortable enough to wear for extended periods of time
Quality construction that produces high-definition sound
cons: Users say that it doesn't block out all of the background noise

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: This is an acceptable home office headset, with adequate sound reproduction and mic. It's not suitable for serious audio but it's not intended to be. The reason for the one star is that the speaker in the left ear stopped working after a month and a half, a couple of weeks outside the 30-day warranty. Part of this is on me as had I bothered to check the warranty I doubt I'd have purchased this headset. 30 days just doesn't cut it. And part of it, of course, is on Logitech for poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: NF

customer_reviews.title: MUTES RANDOMLY!
customer_reviews.text: Zero stars for the product. A million stars for Amazon. Kept muting randomly, even though the mute button wasn't activated. If I didn't have a friend with a headset for me to borrow, I would have lost my new job. Frustrating, to say the least! But Amazon, as always, is excellent about replacing defective products. Don't know yet if the new headset will work. Keeping my fingers crossed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Functional Fine Frivolous Failure
customer_reviews.text: The headset is still working after months of use. I prefer only one ear covered making the design appealing to me. I also like the lightweight of the headset. The one problem that I have had is the coating on the ear-piece peeling off for no apparent reason. I store the headset in a safe place that would not expose it to anything unusual that would make it peel. I probably would buy a different product simply because the peeling has exposed the foam and the foam is now deteriorating.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hanrahan

customer_reviews.title: Great work headset for these COVID-19 times
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this headset to use on work calls with video, and it looks professional while being comfortable to wear for long periods of time and easy to control. It's great to be able to change volume and un/mute with the in-line controller. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: B.H.E.

customer_reviews.title: Great with Skype for Business and meetings
customer_reviews.text: This headset is now my daily driver when I'm in a meeting where I'll be talking. I even use this headset now when giving virtual presentations because it produces reliably consistent microphone sound. I use primarily Skype for Business in an enterprise atmosphere. I occasionally use some other platforms, like Slack, etc. The call controls (like hang-up and mute button) control your Skype meeting, but won't control other platforms like Slack. The volume keys will change your Windows sound volume when the headset is plugged in so those will work regardless of the platform.
customer_reviews.author: Public Name

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality mic
customer_reviews.text: This is a very very poor product. It makes noise the entire time. Like a humming buzzing. If you click mute or unmute there is a “loading” sound that shows up clearly on recordings. I have tried plugging this in directly into the Mac and into a usb splitter and nothing changes the poor quality. Still looking for a clean mic.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for cooperative gaming, but excels in voice recognition
customer_reviews.text: I originally needed a single-sided headset for VATSIM, and this was what I found (I did not look all that hard). I was very pleased to discover that my voice recognition software (both M$ and Dragn) performed with noticeably greater accuracy using this headset compared to an expensive, high-end gaming headset. I believe it's a combination of very directional microphone and that this headset is audio-balanced for voice over music and sounds. If you are looking for and audio headset, you shouldn't even be reading this review. This is a headset designed for VOIP conversation and excels in that focused application.
customer_reviews.author: ChuckTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Did not last long at all and wires are coming apart. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Mic cuts out. Caused massive issues on a conference call. Very disappointing from Logitech.
customer_reviews.text: Mic cuts out. Caused massive issues on a conference call. Very disappointing from Logitech. This was plugged directly into the computer. Mic cut out often on Skype for Business. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Logitech USB Headset H570e Stereo - Black
customer_reviews.text: Because of the pandemic, I had to revert to teaching a college class by videoconferencing. I obtained this Logitech USB Headset H570e and it's _fantastic_. I would say that the audio is outstanding. I'm sorry that I can't meet with my students in the classroom, but this headset ensures that my students can hear me very clearly. This was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: bardahl

customer_reviews.title: Painful to Wear
customer_reviews.text: I teach online and bought these hoping for comfort during my long stretches of teaching - 5 hours. Unfortunately the head clasp pinches and is very uncomfortable after 10 minutes. I do have a larger head, so perhaps it’s a compatibility issue ... but if you are looking for comfort, I don’t recommend these. After a week of use I decided I just can’t use these every day, I will use them in emergency situations only.
customer_reviews.author: Momof3

customer_reviews.title: Good, clear sound bit volume is a little weak
customer_reviews.text: Clear sound and it does what I need for speaking via Skype and other apps. Easy setup although it can catch you off guard if your switching between this and the headphone jack. The sound is loud enough so far for conversation but I worry that it won't be loud enough in the future is I'm speaking to somebody who's sound is a little weak. I say this because the volume with this set does not get as loud as other devices using the headstock Jack. I don't know if that's the nature of USB headphone or not but it would be nice to have a little higher volume options.
customer_reviews.author: lizardflix

customer_reviews.title: If you are planning to use this on wndows - you will be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why noone else has complained. i do not know if the fault lies with Windows (microsoft) or logitech. The sound automatically maxes out on the control panel and you can try all the stuff available on the web about how to fix - nothing doing. The mic is so sensitive it can pick stuff from the next room - all the folks I was talking with had to reduce the incoming mic sound. If it was $10-$15 no worries but at $30+ this is a waste of my money. Now some folks don't have an issue so it is a hit or miss I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Ilse Shah

customer_reviews.title: Works, for now
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap. I previously owned a similar previous model from Logitech, and it broke after a few years. This one probably will too. It does not feel like it is built to last. The audio quality is superb. This headset is designed for conference calls, not listening to music, but music sounds clearer than it does from my regular headphones. That's good.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and sound quality which were my two most important requirements. I have a couple of minor issues that prevented a 5 star rating. The inline controls are on the cable in a place that ends up right in front of me on my desk. That is helpful when making an adjustment, but on the downside I end up accidentally leaning on them. It would be better if the controls on the headset or another foot down the cable. Also, it would be nice if it came with a windscreen for the microphone. I haven't had any issues with wind noise yet, but I like to be safe instead of sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Passout

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, good sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a one-earpiece headset for video conferencing needs. I've used it almost daily since purchased. I was using it yesterday and forgot that I had it on! (i.e. comfortable!) The mic works great and I can change which ear I leave uncovered. I have a foam wind-screen on the mic and the sound is very clear to those with whom I'm conversing. The open ear is great if I choose to use an external speaker or device. No real cons for the intended application.
customer_reviews.author: NJH51

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is great!!
customer_reviews.text: It was hard to decide between 3 and 4 star on this item. Sound quality is great!!! I don't really like how it interface on Windows 10 but that's not the issue with this product. It loses it's start on two things. 1. Headrest? part is non-adjustable. I guess I have larger head? and the other end where it's supposed to rest on top of ear to be comfortable rest on 45 degree angle toward top of my head, making it uncomfortable. 2. Ear piece, while it has great sound, warms up very quickly. After wearing it for about 30+mins, you can feel the heat coming from between my ear and the ear piece.... Considering returning it.. but haven't decided.
customer_reviews.author: DEP

customer_reviews.title: Great Headset - Only one gripe
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure if there is a way around this issue i had. The volume control is at just the right length to get stuck under a desk ledge. I had to make sure that the cord was always laying across the desk - never dipping down between me and the desk. If it did then YANK and unexpected times. Could have preferred the controls to be on the headset itself or at least round the control widget corners so it wouldn't get caught otherwise the headset is excellent
customer_reviews.author: G. Smith

customer_reviews.title: the sound was fine. If you were using it just to listen
customer_reviews.text: Kept muting accidentally even though the mute button wasn't activated. I would have to dial out of the phone call I was on and dial back in so I could be heard for a couple more minutes ... then I'd repeat the process in another couple of minutes. That defeats the purpose of having a headset for phone calls. On the plus side, the sound was fine. If you were using it just to listen, it would work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Kocher Brown

customer_reviews.title: They’re ok
customer_reviews.text: I go through lots of these since I work from home and have a curious pup. I do not find these to be the most comfortable. In meetings my sound is distorted so I have to keep them half on and half off.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Marie

customer_reviews.title: Even though I could hear them fine, I blamed my voice over internet phone
customer_reviews.text: After only a few weeks, customers started complaining that I was breaking up. Even though I could hear them fine, I blamed my voice over internet phone. A few more weeks go by and the mic stopped working entirely. Headset has been treated gently. I used it about 20 hours per week for about 10 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kane

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one week
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I teach online. They worked for about 1 week. Now there is only sound in one ear and my students can no longer hear me speak.
customer_reviews.author: KatieKateP

customer_reviews.title: Top notch
customer_reviews.text: One of the best USB headsets for the computer. Clarity is top notch. Tried several other pairs including a Microsoft one which only lasted a short while and then started cutting out. Another company we tried had a head set that only worked when it wanted to. No complaints with this one.
customer_reviews.author: J the Mac Guy

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Normally Logitech is fantastic. These are good quality and designed well. But the sound is just ok, and the earpiece hurts after a little while. I wouldn't do it.
customer_reviews.author: dhoopstick

customer_reviews.title: Mono headphone stopped working within 1-2 Weeks
customer_reviews.text: Loved this headset at first because it was lightweight and worked fine for all my needs (teleconferencing). Then, one day, a couple weeks after buying it, after I got off from one call and then started another call, I noticed there was no sound coming from the headset anymore. No idea why. I didn't even get up from my desk or change any settings or anything between the two calls. Tried all troubleshooting to no avail and ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: janor123

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, needs clip for cord/buttons
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Love the USB plug and Skype instant-compatibility. Only negatives is that it doesn't come with any instructions (especially when used with Skype), and there is no clip or anything to hold the buttons on your clothing. Which means it sits / hangs, can be slow to find when you need to hit unmute button, or the unmute button can inadvertently be pressed as it dangles, potentially leading to embarrassing comments being broadcast. Sound quality, including for listening to music, is good.
customer_reviews.author: VillageCat

customer_reviews.title: We bought a fleet of these for company employee use ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought a fleet of these for company employee use. The pricepoint and general performance, along with the non-foam earpiece did the job ok for ShoreTel and Skype use. It does pick up surrounding noise but the mic is adjustable - just bend it close to the mouth. The mute button and volume control also helps. Overall I would prefer analog inputs over USB when possible, as software does have a tendency to switch around the settings when you plug these into a different USB slot. The workaround is to keep this plugged in the same slot.
customer_reviews.author: Admin P.

customer_reviews.title: Great performance, wish it fit better.
customer_reviews.text: This headset works very well, and the price is good. My only complaint is that they feel a little tight on my head, and after a long conference call leave me with a slight headache. I wish there was a way to loosen the tension in the head band. If there was I would have given these 5 stars. The sound quality is excellent, and other callers say that they can hear me loud and clear. They perform well, and appear to be made well. It is the typical well-built quality I expect from Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: ctleng76

customer_reviews.title: Microphone works nice, and the in-line buttons are good
customer_reviews.text: The material feel a bit cheap, and the sound is not to high, but if you rise the volume you hear perfectly, I use them occasionally during the day, to make 3 or 4 calls in my computer. Microphone works nice, and the in-line buttons are good, it has a red led indicator when you are on mute. It is not made for big heads. I really like it for the price is good.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Business Skype or phone calls.
customer_reviews.text: This headset works great for Skype and phone calls with easy setup. If you are looking for a headset with mic for gaming, spend the extra money and buy a high end setup. If it is for Skype and occasional gaming, this will be a good choice...
customer_reviews.author: John Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: The speaker on this headset stopped working after 6 months. That is not acceptable. I expect something like this to last for years. I am very careful with equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Blodwyn

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: The quality of sounds is OK with its price. One star was deducted as the mute button didn't work with Logitech's own program, Logitech Cam settings. It took an hour for me to find out the culprit.
customer_reviews.author: Y. J.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Audio Quality | Decently comfortable | Affordable Price
customer_reviews.text: My expectations weren't very high when I bought these considering the price. I use them for work (I work remote). They have never given me any problems. The mute button works perfect. I haven't even tried using the call button but I don't use Lync so I don't think it matters. My ear does start to hurt a tiny bit once in a while but I just adjust them and it's fine. If you're looking for a good headset for Gotomeeting or hangouts, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Arty

customer_reviews.title: I buy in bulk
customer_reviews.text: I buy these for our company about 5 at a time. Absolutely love them. The super thing about them is they work when you plug them in...that probably sounds like a derp, but if you use Voip a lot, you know that if you have a bluetooth headset and all this other junk that is out there, you can spend a month trying to troubleshoot call quality issues, etc. With these, you plug them in and they work. If there is a problem, chances are it is your computer.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable - fast free shipping
customer_reviews.text: My headset arrived 6 days after the order with free shipping - about a week ahead of the original estimate. Windows 7 loaded the drivers immediately upon plug-in and the quality is perfect. I also have a Logitech double ear headset but wanted a lighter weight for use during my shifts as a work-at-home call center operator. This headset is very light and the earpiece fits comfortably with only a slight pressure. I highly recommend this for anyone who needs a single ear headset.
customer_reviews.author: Gene R

customer_reviews.title: A Reasonably Priced Headset.
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. It makes my working from home a 1000% easier, now that I don't have to sacrifice note-taking for phone-cradling. These provide clear call quality with Skype and allow me to toggle easily from listening to music to answering a call. Worth every penny. They were basically plug and play; I only had to do minor tweaking of my settings to get the audio where I wanted it.
customer_reviews.author: Cipher Art

customer_reviews.title: Love This Headset
customer_reviews.text: I work at home frequently and needed to upgrade my headset to use with my company's new Skype for Business phone system. I have had this headset for about 2 months and it works perfectly! The call clarity and audio is excellent. I get no echo during calls. The cord is fairly long so you can stand up and move a bit during calls. The call control panel on the cord is a must--you can easily mute/unmute, adjust the volume, and hang the call up.
customer_reviews.author: reb4864

customer_reviews.title: Gaming or work from home!
customer_reviews.text: Slight feedback but good to make sure you don’t sound crazy. Use them for a work from home position and they are great!
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Need some setting adjustment to work for me
customer_reviews.text: I am using this for Lync, songs and games. I need to go to the headset Earphone Properties' enhancements settings to turn on the loudness equalization for it to sound equally loud across different applications. For games and songs, it works pretty well but need to note that this is not a Hi-Fi set. So lower frequency beat may not be audible. As for Lync, the buttons works perfectly on adjusting the loudness, mute and answering/hanging up the call. Somehow the voice feedback doesn't sound right, it is a bit too loud. Other than that, I feel comfortable to put on this headset.
customer_reviews.author: Kheun

customer_reviews.title: Best computer headphone/mic I've found.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic PC headphone/mic. I've tried a few, and this one is the best. Works great for games. Works with Windows and Linux. Sound quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: Phill

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Home Office Unit
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Not "great", but good. Bought these for home office phone support job, so I anticipate wearing them for 9 hours straight. Was surprised on opening at how small the ear cups are. Also, very tight at first, but quite flexible headband should allow them to stretch over time. I have already found that if I wear these at the very front of my ears then they are much more comfortable than when they are pressing my outer ear against my head if worn further back. Audio quality is quite good for virtually all purposes and mic is particularly crisp and clear. Not a purist's headset, but a very good home office type, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Really, really small headset.
customer_reviews.text: The headset is very small. If you have average or larger ears it will not fit well. Sound quality is mediocre and gets worse when you run both an audio stream and a voip session. For example a game and discord. Build materials are fine. Go with a logitech h210 if you want a much better headset for cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: C.bright

customer_reviews.title: Good Price and Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I like it. That said it is a bit too tight for my head. Nobody ever said I have a big head so I don't think it is about that. It is flexible of course and I have not broken it in stretching out it to fit more loosely on my head so likely it will work out in the end perfectly for me. Good price and product.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Orlando

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, mediocre quality
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable enough for long calls or meetings. Never heard any complaints about sound quality or background noise. However, after six months of regular use, the microphone stopped working reliably, and I had to replace this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Niteflier

customer_reviews.title: pretty good quality in both directions
customer_reviews.text: pretty good quality in both directions, but if the mic is directly in front of my mouth it clips. it seems like i could correct this by messing with the settings, but things get complex at this point. minor problem, however--and this is more amusing than annoying. the volume up/down is reversed for me. i have no idea how that happened. the mute button is convenient, but i've NEVER accidentally hit it. cool, huh?
customer_reviews.author: buttsatan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect headset!
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable and I can actually hear the sound!! They fit perfectly with little adjustment and the microphone works wonderful, these are great and the price is right!!
customer_reviews.author: Connie N. Eauclaire

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Great, works exactly as it should. Only thing I would add would be a clip for more control of the long cord.
customer_reviews.author: Cat_Phi3X

customer_reviews.title: Happy thus far
customer_reviews.text: Works and works well, only started using it. I do allot of work calls, so far it does its job and the mute switch and volume controls are handy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good buy
customer_reviews.text: They didn't cancel out all excess noise. They were a little tight on my ears as well.
customer_reviews.author: Momof3boys

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: It has a DSP or Amp ic built in. So the overall performance is great, especially on thin/zero clients.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Hu

customer_reviews.title: Surprised at the quality
customer_reviews.text: These are great for recording audio or speaking on a professional call.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen R. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Works well, people can hear u clear
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on windows 10 no drivers no nothing windows took over once they plugged in. Mic and ear phones are great.
customer_reviews.author: DAMAN21

customer_reviews.title: USB headset
customer_reviews.text: The headset works great, but they do make my ears hurt after wearing them for a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works well.
customer_reviews.text: The head and ear cushions are comfortable. The volume controls are quite adjustable. The mute button is great. The microphone boom is very adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Very nice headset
customer_reviews.text: I really like these, they are very comfortable and the sound quality is very good for meetings and training sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Miller

customer_reviews.title: The Search for a Softer Pillow is Needed
customer_reviews.text: I would say that the headset serves it purpose with average sound quality and the microphone is produces clear sound to others. There is one major drawback with this headset which are the padded speakers. After a while in wearing them they become uncomfortable as the padding seems to be made with a heavy dense foam in such a small diameter of speaker. I would only recommend short time frames in using this product as your ears will tend to feel sore after a while. The headset overall is useful in what it does but to you the consumer Logitech has to redesign the padding in circumference and with a softer filling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easily recognized by my windows 10 desktop
customer_reviews.text: Easily recognized by my windows 10 desktop. Easy to change settings through window's control panel. Works good with Ring Central VOIP and is comfortable. There's probably a newer version out, as logitech's website doesn't have much info on this product #, however support is still available.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Used for more than 1,000 hours
customer_reviews.text: Amazing lightweight headset. I've used it for conferencing on Skype over the last year. It's very comfortable, plug and play, and sounds great. It still looks brand new with minimal wear despite heavy use. I'd get one again in a heartbeat if this one broke.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Goff

customer_reviews.title: Great for work, no problems!
customer_reviews.text: I use these for business as on conference bridges most the day and ear buds start hurting my ear after a while. They are great, immediatly worked when I plugged them in!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Nixon

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Not really noise cancelling but pretty sure it's not meant to be.
customer_reviews.author: lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done I guess
customer_reviews.text: Enjoyed it while it worked, but the microphone stopped functioning after six months. I can still use it as a clunky earpiece for videocalls and use a lapel mic in addition, but the headset's microphone up and quit on me after being lightly used once a week and sitting in a drawer for the rest of its time. Can't figure out what went wrong, but this is my third logitech headset I've burned through this past year, so I think I'm done with the brand.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Beus

customer_reviews.title: Volume control is badly positioned
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a nice headset with a critical design failure. The volume control box is located about 20 inches down the cord where it constantly gets caught on the arms of my office chair. Extremely irritating, 6-8 inches further up and it would have been perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hello?  I can't hear you!
customer_reviews.text: These unfortunately did not work well for me. Perhaps I got a bad pair but I was in a quiet room and people consistently complained of static and that they could hear me. I have a pair from another company that works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Frank H

customer_reviews.title: I tried this headset for Cisco IP Communicator. Calls ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried this headset for Cisco IP Communicator. Calls are clear. The mute and voice up/down do work. The one function that does not work is the pickup/hangup button. I have to click the Softphone icon to hang up a call.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto

customer_reviews.title: Good headset for home office
customer_reviews.text: Used for my home office and does a good job canceling some of the news upstairs when I am on conference calls. Microphone still picks it up so be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Pulsfort

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Nice, simple, clear. I use this at least 3 hours a day at work with no problems. I found that I use the mute button for every meeting, and it's good to have the "connected" light reminding you that you're on a call, or at least the headset is being actively used by a program. As it suggests in the description, the physical mute button will work with the telecom software you're using (i.e. Skype, Skype for Business (which replaced Lync), GoToMeeting, etc) without any setup required. Nice for once to have something "plug-and-play" actually mean that.
customer_reviews.author: D. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Great headset
customer_reviews.text: Can't complain. Does what it's supposed to do. Loud and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Circles

customer_reviews.title: I guess it works but the audio quality is pretty bad.
customer_reviews.text: It does work. The one that I got wasn't broken or anything (at least I don't think it was), but the audio quality for both the headphones and the mic were much worse than I had expected. It was like I was just talking on the phone. The audio quality is as low as I am disappointed, and I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: LightwaveAlice

customer_reviews.title: The mic is a little too sensitive at picking up room noise but otherwise they are great. Works with everything and no real setup
customer_reviews.text: Use these headsets for all of our voip systems. The mic is a little too sensitive at picking up room noise but otherwise they are great. Works with everything and no real setup. No drivers necessary.
customer_reviews.author: W. Kapes

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, sound clear
customer_reviews.text: Be careful with the controls, inadvertently you may press the buttons and unmute the mic.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: ... but I have to say that the sound is amazing with this set
customer_reviews.text: we were told that we needed to use headsets at work and I was not thrilled but I have to say that the sound is amazing with this set. You can make crisp clean and clear calls and it was easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: MagdaO

customer_reviews.title: Did NOT eliminate echo
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping using USB headset would remove the feedback/echo from online meetings. Just the opposite - these made it worse. Can't even use them. Got out the duct tape and went back to the old mini plug broken headset.
customer_reviews.author: Phelix

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! Had 1.5 weeks and it stopped working. My coworker bought the same item through Staples and had the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Great headset at a low price for VoIP roll out ...
customer_reviews.text: Great headset at a low price for VoIP roll out within the company. I did purchase a bulk amount of these and a few were duds so I am knocking a star for potential QC issues. Aside from that the volume for both input and output are good and the clarity is also good.
customer_reviews.author: William Morris

customer_reviews.title: Great for a tech advisor!
customer_reviews.text: I work in a call center and this headset works great! No problem hearing my callers. The mic is hot so I had to turn the volume down but that’s not really an issue!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Another great product by Logitech!  Great for conferencing on the go!
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality and build quality for the price. The ear piece is super comfortable as and the cushioning around the crown of the headband is a nice touch. I like that the mic boom flexes - perfect if you prefer speaking softly and want the mic close to your mouth. Overall, I like how it is compact and easy to throw in my bag if I'm working remotely and need to make a call / conference in. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Aldrin

customer_reviews.title: I like the single earpiece so I can hear ambient noise ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well, no problems. Plug into computer and it works. I like the single earpiece so I can hear ambient noise with the other ear.
customer_reviews.author: Jael

customer_reviews.title: go-to for mono USB headsets
customer_reviews.text: We've purchased a lot of these. They have great quality and none of them have broken on our operators.
customer_reviews.author: Justin B.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily for my job. It is very comfortable to wear and the ease of use is amazing. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Very good audio quality.
customer_reviews.text: A bit snug on my head at the moment, but I'm guessing it will loosen up over time. Audio quality is very good, and it was easy to set up on my MacBook Pro. Great accessory if you're a Webex user.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mike

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound quality and the headband was too tight
customer_reviews.text: Poor sound quality and the headband was too tight. I tried to open it but it was just too tight and I have an average size head.
customer_reviews.author: coliver

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: It worked well except I wouldn't use it for long hours. My ears hurt after a long day using it for work.
customer_reviews.author: Fantails24

customer_reviews.title: Mic stopped working after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Mic stopped working after 4 months. Amazon is seller but it doesn't give warranty. I have to contact manufacture.
customer_reviews.author: Luba D.

customer_reviews.title: The best in it's price range!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried dozens of headset/microphone combos for use with my VOIP workstation phone. This one is comfortable to wear (even on my big head!), sound is clear and I never get any complaints from callers that I'm breaking up. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: E.E.S.

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Mic is a bit sensitive but the worst thing is these are really uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Microphone stopped working at around 9 months.....
customer_reviews.text: Until the microphone stopped working it was an okay headset. Sucks to have wasted the money for only nine months of use though.
customer_reviews.author: Del H

customer_reviews.title: is comfortable enough, and audio/mic is clear
customer_reviews.text: Solid and reliable headphones (for the price). Fits well, is comfortable enough, and audio/mic is clear. I work full-time from home and often half of my day is GoTo Meetings or other similar Webinars, both as a host or an attendee. Have not had an issue after a week or so of use.
customer_reviews.author: Big BatouTop Contributor: Batman

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunate
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, it just wasn't working properly. Some calls were super low, some were normal. Sometimes the line would cut off alot and it sucks that for this price, the headphones are shotty. One of my coworkers bought the same ones and hers caught a short. :(
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Good $30-$40 headseat. Gaming
customer_reviews.text: I would say average comfort and performance for a stereo headset. I use mine for gaming and does the trick. Should suit most peoples purposes for sound and mic...Hey, its in the $30-$40 range...if you need top of the line, pay more
customer_reviews.author: Stevereeno

customer_reviews.title: Suitable
customer_reviews.text: These suit my purpose for my Win 7 laptop and Win 8.1 computer-- but unfortunately they don't work with my favorite PC-- XP. Logitech was my choice between a Microsoft and another brand I can't think of right now. Logitech is a good brand for computer accessories...
customer_reviews.author: H from SPhilly

customer_reviews.title: Not built to last, will never buy another logitech headset
customer_reviews.text: Stopped playing sound through right headphone after a little over a month of light use. Headset was treated well, it either sat on my desk or head and was never yanked, thrown, stepped on, or mistreated in any way. Have had similar experiences with other Logitech headsets, but never so soon, I could usually get a bare minimum of 1 year out of them. I'm tired of having to replace sub-par, defective junk, and will never buy Logitech again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this headset!
customer_reviews.text: It is perfect in every way! Love the mute feature-comes in handy. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Aleiya B

customer_reviews.title: perfect for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Great headset. I use this for gaming since I prefer to only have one ear covered. Everyone said they can hear me clearly and I have no issues hearing them. Very comfortable to wear for extended periods.
customer_reviews.author: P_Kaesberg

customer_reviews.title: So happy I bought this!
customer_reviews.text: I work from home part time and sometimes I'm on comference calls for at least an hour. Laptop speakers aren't that great. The headphones are comfortable and the adjustable microphone is wonderful. All this for a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Widdershins

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Choice for My Needs
customer_reviews.text: Attended an online class. Needed headphones for discussions. Excellent product. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jill  Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Plugged it in and it's tremendous noise cancelling ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Plugged it in and it's tremendous noise cancelling right out of the box. I tested in a condo near the highway with the window open and recordings made with this product cancelled out the noise very well.
customer_reviews.author: Zach A.

customer_reviews.title: He said the sound quality and connections are excellent. Well worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this per recommendation from another professor for his online classes. He said the sound quality and connections are excellent. Well worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Karen R.K.

customer_reviews.title: Noise Cancellation is not all that great
customer_reviews.text: Making money with these head sets they will run for the long haul.
customer_reviews.author: alladin

customer_reviews.title: Nice and light
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Needed a light weight headset for ZOOM conferences and this work great. I get good audio reports and can hear clearly the other participants.
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeye

customer_reviews.title: Logitech fixed.. most of Logitech stuff is a 5
customer_reviews.text: worked and then half (one side failed) logitech send out new one no cost :-)
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth H.

product_meta.title: Logitech USB Headset H570e Stereo - Black
product_meta.description: Style:stereo| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe Logitech USB Headset H570e, available in corded mono and stereo versions, delivers enterprise-quality audio at an affordable price for crystal-clear communication and long wearing comfort. System Requirements: Windows 7 or highermacOS 10.7 or higher LinuxOne USB 2.0 port|Certified for Skype for Business and compatible with most leading services such as Zoom BlueJeans Google Hangouts Pro Cisco and more.1
feature_bullets: Headphones form factor: On ear vertical
Double ear USB stereo headset: Ideal for blocking out noise in open workspaces and home offices during desktop calls
Plug and play compatibility: Works with pc, mac, microsoft lync, cisco, skype and most leading uc platforms
Enterprise quality audio at an affordable entry level price: Business grade wideband audio, digital signal processing (dsp) and noise cancelling boom mic for crystal clear conversations
Comfort and control: Durable padded headband and ear cups; Convenient inline call controls and incoming call indicator light
This business product ships in brown box with no retail packaging
